column4: there is a proprietary external cd drive, i just don't have it
is that usb? is it recognized on boot or when you plug it in?
nah, it's pcmcia, and when i plug it in, nothin happens
do you boot with it already plugged in?
and no, doesn't do anything upon boot or if i plug it in while
yah, i've tried booting with it, still nothing
try verbose boot, then check to boot logs for the scan results
the card may not have free drivers and you may have to use NDIS

the way I installed ubuntu is by putting the hdd in a nother laptop to have the live cd copy the install files onto theo hdd, then i removed the hdd at reboot and put it in my tavelmate 340 to finish the install -- perhaps it doesn't recognize the pcmcia slot?  (is that possible?  cuase I had to reconfigure xorg to detect my display cuase ti was looking for the ati display fro mthe laptop i originally started the install on)
i'll try that, one sec
i'm actually really new to all this, how would I do verbose boot?
yes, that is concievable that the installer would not have installed the PCMCIA if you installed on another box
and now that you mention it, i was on google reading about how people wre having to use some files from teh windows driver and wrapping it up w/something else
I have to look it up every time
any idea how i woudl get the pcmcia slot "installed"?
yes that's the NDIS stuff that would mean your card needs that
I'm not the best to help, I'm just trying to give you what pointers I can

and would there ahve been a better way to install ubuntu than the way I did?  (like i said, i've got an old acer travelmade 340 w/no usb boot support (so no external drive for installation) and no working thernet
it's all good, i still appreciate it
floppy?
nope -- nothing lol
so i guess my best solution would be to get a hold of that --- yah, i figured lol
i did finally get everytign elseworking at least :-) (besides wireless, and pcmcia apparently lol)
thanks again
